- **Results:** Identified problem classes where QAOA outperforms classical heuristics.

messages.content:
## Quantum Machine Learning

Quantum machine learning (QML) has rapidly progressed from theoretical proposals to practical demonstrations across multiple domains. Survey work highlights variational quantum circuits for molecular property prediction, revealing potential speed‑ups in drug discovery while emphasizing the need for error‑mitigation (Liu, Zhang, & Patel, 2023). Benchmark studies on noisy intermediate‑scale quantum (NISQ) devices show modest accuracy gains for supervised learning tasks when employing noise‑resilient techniques (Kim & Alvarez, 2022). Hybrid classical‑quantum neural networks, integrating convolutional layers with quantum variational layers, achieve state‑of‑the‑art performance on image classification benchmarks such as MNIST (O'Connor & Gupta, 2024). In reinforcement learning, quantum superposition enables simultaneous exploration of policy spaces, leading to faster convergence on classic control problems (Ahmed & Zhou, 2023). Graph‑structured data benefit from quantum graph neural networks, which improve node classification on citation datasets (Rossi & Tanaka, 2022). Finally, surveys of QML algorithms for combinatorial optimization illustrate that quantum approximate optimization algorithms can outperform classical heuristics for specific problem classes, though widespread applicability awaits further hardware improvements (Müller & Singh, 2024).
